name: Typography
content:
Typography: Optimized font sizes (11px base) and weights (450-600) for a precise, "engineered" look.
Letter Spacing: Added subtle letter-spacing adjustments (0.01em and -0.01em) for improved readability and style.
Density: Increased information density while maintaining breathability.
Micro-Animations: Added smooth transitions for tab switching, button hovers, and list interactions.
notes: Native UI design guidelines and typographic specifications.

name: Cargo: New Project
content: cargo new <name>
notes: Creates a new Rust project in a folder with the given name.

name: Cargo: Build
content: cargo build
notes: Compiles the current project and its dependencies.

name: Cargo: Run
content: cargo run
notes: Compiles and executes the current project binary.

name: Cargo: Check
content: cargo check
notes: Quickly check code for errors without building the full binary.

name: Cargo: Test
content: cargo test
notes: Runs all unit and integration tests defined in the project.

name: NPM: Compile
content: npm run compile
notes: Compiles the extension code using the defined build script.

name: VSCE: Package
content: npx vsce package
notes: Packages the extension into a .vsix file for installation.

name: Git: Init
content: git init
notes: Initializes a new local Git repository in the current folder.

name: Git: Clone
content: git clone <url>
notes: Clones a remote repository to your local machine.

name: Git: Status
content: git status
notes: Displays the state of the working directory and staging area.

name: Git: Commit
content: git commit -m "<message>"
notes: Records changes to the repository with a descriptive message.

name: Git: Fetch & Pull
content: git pull origin main
notes: Fetches and integrates changes from the remote main branch.

name: Git: Push
content: git push -u origin main
notes: Uploads local commits to the remote main branch.

name: Docker: Build
content: docker build -t <tag> .
notes: Builds an image from a Dockerfile in the current directory.

name: Docker: Run
content: docker run -it <image>
notes: Starts a container from an image in interactive mode.

name: Docker: List Images
content: docker images
notes: Lists all Docker images stored locally.

name: Docker: List Containers
content: docker ps -a
notes: Lists all containers, including stopped ones.

name: CMake: Build
content: cmake --build build
notes: Builds a C++ project using CMake generated build files.

name: Rust: Update Toolchain
content: rustup update
notes: Updates the Rust toolchain to the latest version.

name: NPM: Install
content: npm install
notes: Installs dependencies specified in package.json.

name: NPM: Run Dev
content: npm run dev
notes: Starts the development server for the project.

name: Git: Branch List
content: git branch
notes: Lists all local branches in the current repository.

name: Git: Checkout
content: git checkout -b <branch>
notes: Creates and switches to a new branch.

name: Docker: Prune System
content: docker system prune -f
notes: Removes unused data to free up disk space.

name: VS Code: Build Extension
content: npm run build
notes: Compiles webview and source code for production.

name: Native UI Guidelines
content:
1. Think native desktop software, not SaaS
2. Typography as a core design system
3. Controlled, limited palette
4. Solid, grounded UI elements
5. Avoid web dashboard aesthetics
notes: Design principles for achieving a premium native application look.

name: PR Template: Standard
content:
## Description
[Provide a brief description of the changes]

## Related Issues
Fixes #[Issue Number]

## Changes Made
- [Refined logic for...]
- [Added new component...]

## Testing Performed
- [x] Manual verification of UI
- [x] Ran automated tests
notes: A standard template for Pull Requests.

name: Code Review Checklist
content:
- [ ] Does the code follow project naming conventions?
- [ ] Are there any obvious logic errors or edge cases missed?
- [ ] Is the code well-commented where necessary?
- [ ] Are there potential performance bottlenecks?
- [ ] Does the UI match the design specification exactly?
notes: General checklist for conducting code reviews.

name: Bug Report Template
content:
## Steps to Reproduce
1. [Step 1]
2. [Step 2]

## Expected Behavior
[What should have happened]

## Actual Behavior
[What actually happened]

## Environment
- OS: [e.g. Windows 11]
- Version: [e.g. 1.0.2]
notes: Structured format for reporting bugs.

name: Conventional Commits Guide
content:
Format: <type>(<scope>): <description>

Types:
- feat: A new feature
- fix: A bug fix
- docs: Documentation changes
- style: Changes that do not affect the meaning of the code
- refactor: A code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature
- perf: A code change that improves performance
- test: Adding missing tests or correcting existing tests
notes: Guideline for writing standardized Git commit messages.

name: System Architecture Overview
content:
## Components
- Provider: Handles VS Code API interaction and data persistence.
- Webview (Media): Manages the UI, state, and user interactions.
- Data Storage: JSON-based local/remote sync via Git.
notes: High-level summary of the Command & Prompt Tracker architecture.

name: Terminal: Scratch folder
content: New-Item -ItemType SymbolicLink -Path "C:\Users\skdso\.gemini\antigravity\scratch" -Target "D:\scratch"
notes: Change your location of the scratch folder

name: Design: Glassmorphism
content:
Keywords: Frosted glass, transparent layers, blurred background, depth, vibrant backdrop

Technical: backdrop-filter: blur(8px), rgba backgrounds, layered cards

Use when: Modern apps, dashboards, overlays, modals

Avoid: Low-contrast backgrounds, accessibility issues
notes: Modern glassmorphism design style with frosted glass effects and transparent layers.

name: Design: Aurora UI
content:
Keywords: Vibrant gradients, smooth blend, Northern Lights effect, mesh gradient, luminous

Technical: Multi-stop gradients, animated hue rotation, glow effects

Use when: Landing pages, hero sections, creative portfolios

Avoid: Text-heavy interfaces, professional/corporate contexts
notes: Aurora-inspired UI design with vibrant gradients and Northern Lights effects.

name: Design: Soft UI (Neumorphism 2.0)
content:
Keywords: Soft shadows, subtle gradients, rounded corners (12-16px), monochromatic, tactile

Technical: box-shadow: inset + outset, same-color palette, minimal contrast

Use when: Mobile apps, minimalist interfaces, wellness/health apps

Avoid: Complex data displays, accessibility-critical applications
notes: Soft UI evolution (Neumorphism 2.0) with subtle shadows and tactile elements.

name: Palette: Trust & Professional
content:
Industry: Finance, Healthcare, Enterprise

Colors:
--primary: #0F172A (Navy)
--cta: #3B82F6 (Blue)
--background: #F8FAFC (Light Grey)
--text: #1E293B (Slate)
--accent: #3B82F6 (Bright Blue)

Mood: Reliable, secure, established
notes: Professional color palette for corporate and enterprise applications.

name: Palette: Vibrant & Modern
content:
Industry: Tech Startups, Creative Tools

Colors:
--primary: #6366F1 (Indigo)
--cta: #10B981 (Emerald)
--background: #FFFFFF (Pure White)
--text: #1E293B (Slate)
--accent: #F59F0B (Amber)

Mood: Innovative, energetic, forward-thinking
notes: Modern vibrant palette for tech startups and creative applications.

name: Palette: Luxury & Premium
content:
Industry: High-end Products, Fashion

Colors:
--primary: #1C1917 (Stone Dark)
--cta: #CA8A04 (Gold)
--background: #FAFAF9 (Cream)
--text: #292524 (Warm Black)
--accent: #78716C (Taupe)

Mood: Sophisticated, exclusive, timeless
notes: Luxury color palette for premium brands and high-end products.

name: Design: Accessibility (WCAG)
content:
Color Contrast:
- Text: Minimum 4.5:1 (AA), 7:1 (AAA)
- Large text: Minimum 3:1 (AA), 4.5:1 (AAA)
- UI components: Minimum 3:1

Interaction:
- Tap targets: 44x44px minimum
- Focus indicators: Visible 2px outline
- Keyboard navigation: Full support

Content:
- Alt text for images
- ARIA labels for interactive elements
- Semantic HTML structure
notes: WCAG 2.1 accessibility guidelines for inclusive design.

name: Design: Typography System
content:
Font Scale (Modular 1.25):
- h1: 3.052rem (48.83px)
- h2: 2.441rem (39.06px)
- h3: 1.953rem (31.25px)
- h4: 1.563rem (25px)
- h5: 1.25rem (20px)
- body: 1rem (16px)
- small: 0.8rem (12.8px)

Line Height:
- Headings: 1.2
- Body: 1.5-1.6
- Dense UI: 1.4

Font Weight:
- Regular: 400
- Medium: 500
- Semibold: 600
- Bold: 700
notes: Harmonious typography system with modular scale and proper hierarchy.

name: Design: Spacing System (8pt Grid)
content:
Base Unit: 8px

Spacing Scale:
- xs: 4px (0.5 unit)
- sm: 8px (1 unit)
- md: 16px (2 units)
- lg: 24px (3 units)
- xl: 32px (4 units)
- 2xl: 48px (6 units)
- 3xl: 64px (8 units)

Component Padding:
- Button: 12px 24px
- Input: 12px 16px
- Card: 24px
- Section: 48px 0
notes: Consistent 8-point grid spacing system for visual harmony.

name: Design: Component Patterns
content:
Buttons:
- Primary: High contrast, single CTA
- Secondary: Outlined, less prominent
- Ghost: Text-only, minimal visual weight
- States: Default, Hover, Active, Disabled

Inputs:
- Label position: Top (mobile) or Left (desktop)
- Error states: Red border + helper text
- Success states: Green checkmark
- Placeholder: 60% opacity of text color

Cards:
- Border radius: 8-12px
- Shadow: 0 2px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1)
- Hover: Lift effect with increased shadow
notes: Common UI component design patterns and best practices.

name: Design: Animation Principles
content:
Duration:
- Micro (hover, toggle): 100-200ms
- Small (tooltip, dropdown): 200-300ms
- Medium (modal, drawer): 300-400ms
- Large (page transition): 400-600ms

Easing:
- Ease-out: Elements entering (cubic-bezier(0.0, 0, 0.2, 1))
- Ease-in: Elements exiting (cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 1, 1))
- Ease-in-out: Elements moving (cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1))

Principles:
- Purposeful: Every animation serves a function
- Subtle: Don't distract from content
- Performant: Use transform and opacity
notes: Animation timing, easing, and performance guidelines.

name: Design: Responsive Breakpoints
content:
Mobile-First Approach:

Breakpoints:
- xs: 0-640px (Mobile)
- sm: 640px-768px (Large Mobile)
- md: 768px-1024px (Tablet)
- lg: 1024px-1280px (Desktop)
- xl: 1280px-1536px (Large Desktop)
- 2xl: 1536px+ (Extra Large)

Fluid Typography:
- Use clamp() for responsive font sizes
- Example: clamp(1rem, 2vw, 1.5rem)

Container:
- Max-width: 1280px
- Padding: 16px (mobile), 24px (tablet), 48px (desktop)
notes: Responsive design breakpoints and fluid scaling techniques.

name: Design: Dark Mode Strategy
content:
Color Adjustments:
- Don't just invert colors
- Reduce white to off-white (#E5E5E5)
- Pure black can be harsh, use #121212
- Increase surface elevation with lighter grays

Contrast:
- Maintain WCAG ratios in dark mode
- Test with color blindness simulators

Image Handling:
- Reduce brightness of images (opacity: 0.8)
- Use different images for dark/light if needed

Implementation:
- CSS custom properties
- prefers-color-scheme media query
- User toggle to override system preference
notes: Guidelines for implementing effective dark mode interfaces.

name: Design: Form Best Practices
content:
Layout:
- Single column for better completion rates
- Group related fields
- Clear visual hierarchy

Labels:
- Always visible (not placeholder-only)
- Position above input on mobile
- Use sentence case

Validation:
- Inline validation after field blur
- Clear, specific error messages
- Success indicators for correct input
- Disable submit until valid

Accessibility:
- Associate labels with inputs (for/id)
- Use proper input types (email, tel, etc.)
- Include autocomplete attributes
notes: Form design patterns for better user experience and conversion.

name: Design: Micro-interactions
content:
Button Feedback:
- Hover: Scale 1.02, brightness increase
- Active: Scale 0.98
- Ripple effect on click

Loading States:
- Skeleton screens for content
- Spinner for actions
- Progress bars for multi-step

Toasts/Notifications:
- Slide in from top-right
- Auto-dismiss after 3-5 seconds
- Include close button
- Stack multiple notifications

Page Transitions:
- Fade between views
- Slide for hierarchical navigation
- Maintain scroll position on back
notes: Micro-interaction patterns that enhance user experience.

name: AI Prompt: React Component
content:
You are an expert React developer. Create a reusable [component name] component that:
- Uses TypeScript with proper type definitions
- Implements [specific features]
- Includes accessibility (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation)
- Uses [Tailwind CSS / styled-components] for styling
- Handles all states: default, hover, active, disabled, error
- Is fully responsive (mobile-first)
- Includes JSDoc comments

Example usage should be shown in code comments.
notes: Template for generating production-ready React components with AI.

name: AI Prompt: Debug Error
content:
I'm getting an error in my [language/framework] code.

Error message:
[paste full error message and stack trace]

Relevant code:
[paste code snippet]

Context:
- Environment: [browser/Node.js/etc.]
- Dependencies: [list relevant packages and versions]
- What I've tried: [attempted solutions]

Goal: [what the code should do]

Please:
1. Explain the root cause
2. Suggest a fix with code
3. Explain why this solution works
4. Suggest ways to prevent similar errors
notes: Structured debugging prompt for getting effective AI help with errors.

name: AI Prompt: Code Review
content:
Review the following [language] code for:
- Potential bugs and logical errors
- Security vulnerabilities
- Performance bottlenecks
- Code smells and anti-patterns
- SOLID principles violations
- Better naming conventions
- Missing error handling
- Accessibility issues (if UI code)

Goal: [what the code does]

[paste code]

Provide:
1. Issues found (with severity: critical/high/medium/low)
2. Specific improvements with code examples
3. Best practices recommendations
notes: Comprehensive code review prompt for quality improvements.

name: AI Prompt: Performance Optimization
content:
Optimize this [framework/language] code for performance:

Current code:
[paste code]

Context:
- This code handles [describe scenario]
- Performance issue: [describe problem, e.g., slow rendering, high memory]
- Scale: [data size, user count, etc.]

Optimize for:
- Rendering performance (use React.memo, useMemo, useCallback)
- Bundle size reduction
- Memory efficiency
- Network requests (caching, batching)
- Load time improvements

Provide:
1. Optimized code with explanations
2. Performance metrics to measure
3. Before/after comparison
notes: Performance optimization prompt with specific metrics and techniques.

name: AI Prompt: Unit Tests
content:
Generate comprehensive unit tests for this code:

[paste code]

Requirements:
- Testing framework: [Jest/Vitest/etc.]
- Test library: [React Testing Library/etc.]
- Coverage: All functions, edge cases, error states
- Mock external dependencies
- Test accessibility (if UI)
- Follow AAA pattern (Arrange, Act, Assert)

Include tests for:
1. Happy path scenarios
2. Edge cases (empty data, null, undefined)
3. Error handling
4. User interactions (if UI)
5. Async operations

Use descriptive test names.
notes: Comprehensive testing prompt for generating quality unit tests.

name: AI Prompt: API Endpoint
content:
Create a RESTful API endpoint in [language/framework]:

Endpoint: [METHOD] /api/[resource]

Requirements:
- Input validation with [Zod/Joi/etc.]
- Error handling (400, 401, 403, 404, 500)
- Database: [PostgreSQL/MongoDB/etc.]
- Authentication: [JWT/OAuth/etc.]
- Rate limiting
- Logging
- TypeScript types
- OpenAPI/Swagger documentation

Include:
1. Route handler
2. Service layer
3. Database query
4. Response format (JSON)
5. Error responses
6. Example request/response
notes: Full-stack API endpoint creation with best practices.

name: AI Prompt: Refactor Legacy Code
content:
Refactor this legacy code to modern standards:

[paste code]

Target:
- Language/Framework: [e.g., ES6+, React 18]
- Goals: [readability, performance, maintainability]

Requirements:
1. Convert to modern syntax (async/await, destructuring, etc.)
2. Extract reusable functions/components
3. Add TypeScript types
4. Improve naming conventions
5. Add error handling
6. Remove code duplication
7. Add comments for complex logic
8. Maintain backward compatibility: [Yes/No]

Provide:
- Refactored code
- Migration guide
- Breaking changes (if any)
notes: Legacy code modernization with step-by-step refactoring.

name: AI Prompt: React Native App
content:
Create a React Native app with Expo for [app purpose]:

Features:
- [List core features]
- Navigation: Tab navigation with [X] screens
- Authentication: [Firebase/Supabase/etc.]
- State management: [Zustand/Redux/Context]
- UI library: [React Native Elements/etc.]

Screens needed:
1. [Screen name]: [description]
2. [Screen name]: [description]

Requirements:
- TypeScript
- Dark mode support
- Offline capability
- Push notifications
- Responsive design (iOS + Android)
- Accessibility features

Provide:
- App structure
- Navigation setup
- Core screens with styling
- State management setup
notes: Complete React Native app generation with modern stack.

name: AI Prompt: Accessibility Audit
content:
Audit this component/page for WCAG 2.1 AA compliance:

[paste code]

Check for:
1. Color contrast (text: 4.5:1, large text: 3:1, UI: 3:1)
2. Keyboard navigation (tab order, focus indicators)
3. Screen reader support (ARIA labels, roles, live regions)
4. Form accessibility (labels, error messages, required fields)
5. Interactive element size (44x44px minimum)
6. Semantic HTML structure
7. Alt text for images
8. Focus traps in modals
9. Skip navigation links

Provide:
- Issues found with severity
- Fixed code
- Testing recommendations
notes: Complete accessibility audit prompt following WCAG guidelines.

name: AI Prompt: Database Schema
content:
Design a database schema for [purpose]:

Requirements:
- Database: [PostgreSQL/MongoDB/etc.]
- ORM: [Prisma/TypeORM/Mongoose/etc.]

Entities needed:
1. [Entity name]: [description]
2. [Entity name]: [description]

Relationships:
- [describe relationships]

Include:
1. Schema definition (SQL/Prisma/etc.)
2. Indexes for performance
3. Foreign key constraints
4. Default values
5. Validation rules
6. Migration files
7. TypeScript types
8. Sample queries

Consider:
- Data integrity
- Query performance
- Scalability
notes: Database schema design with migrations and types.

name: AI Prompt: Security Review
content:
Security review for this [language/framework] code:

[paste code]

Check for:
1. SQL Injection vulnerabilities
2. XSS (Cross-Site Scripting)
3. CSRF protection
4. Authentication flaws
5. Authorization bypasses
6. Sensitive data exposure
7. Insecure dependencies
8. API key leaks
9. Input validation
10. Rate limiting
11. CORS configuration
12. Password hashing (bcrypt, Argon2)

Provide:
- Vulnerabilities (with OWASP classification)
- Severity rating (Critical/High/Medium/Low)
- Exploitability
- Remediation code
- Security best practices
notes: Security audit prompt following OWASP standards.

name: AI Prompt: TypeScript Migration
content:
Convert this JavaScript code to TypeScript:

[paste JavaScript code]

Requirements:
1. Add comprehensive type definitions
2. Use interfaces for objects
3. Use enums where appropriate
4. Add generic types for reusable functions
5. Use strict mode (noImplicitAny, strictNullChecks)
6. Type all function parameters and returns
7. Use utility types (Partial, Pick, Omit, etc.)
8. Add JSDoc for complex types

Provide:
- Fully typed code
- Type definitions file (.d.ts) if needed
- Explanation of type choices
notes: JavaScript to TypeScript migration with strict typing.

name: AI Prompt: CSS Architecture
content:
Create a CSS architecture for [project type]:

Approach: [Tailwind/CSS Modules/Styled Components/BEM]

Requirements:
1. Design tokens (colors, spacing, typography, shadows)
2. Utility classes for common patterns
3. Component-specific styles
4. Responsive breakpoints
5. Dark mode support
6. Animation utilities
7. Print styles
8. CSS custom properties

Organization:
- File structure
- Naming conventions
- Style composition
- Optimization strategy

Provide:
- Base styles
- Configuration file
- Example component styles
- Documentation
notes: Complete CSS architecture setup with design system.

name: AI Prompt: Next.js App
content:
Create a Next.js 14+ app with App Router:

Project: [name and purpose]

Features:
- [list features]
- Authentication: [NextAuth/Clerk/etc.]
- Database: [Prisma + PostgreSQL/etc.]
- Styling: [Tailwind CSS/etc.]
- Deployment: [Vercel/etc.]

Pages/Routes:
1. / - Homepage
2. [list other routes]

Requirements:
- TypeScript
- Server Components where possible

- Loading and error states
- Server actions for mutations
- Responsive design

Provide:
- Project structure
- Core pages

notes: Modern Next.js app with App Router and server components.

name: AI Prompt: Code Documentation
content:
Generate comprehensive documentation for this code:

[paste code]

Include:
1. Function/Class overview
2. Parameters (type, description, required/optional, default)
3. Return value (type, description)
4. Throws/Errors (what exceptions, when)
5. Usage examples (3-5 real-world scenarios)
6. Edge cases and caveats
7. Performance considerations
8. Related functions/classes
9. TypeScript types (if applicable)
10. @deprecated if legacy

Format: [JSDoc/TSDoc/Markdown]

Style:
- Clear and concise
- Technical but readable
- Include code examples
- Link to related docs
notes: Complete code documentation generation with examples.
